result.execSummary:
The defendant Melinda R Wollenberg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
-Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations. 
-Defendant has 4 days credit if revoked.

Sent to Defendant and DOC.

Defendant appeared in Court. Atty A. Gelhar appeared in Court. 
Assistant District Attorney Kat Turner: Present. 
Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights filed with the Court. 
Plea: Guilty. 
Defendant questioned, rights explained. 
Plea accepted, Court finds guilty. 
Sentence recommendations from counsel. 
State asks for  2 uncharged bail jumping charges be dismissed and read in for sentencing. 
Court states the 2 uncharged charges will be dismissed and read in for sentencing. 
Sentence Withheld - 1 year probation with the following conditions:  
-Pay costs/supervision fees. 
-Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations. 
- Defendant has 4 days of credit if revoked.
Defendant advised of appeal rights.
